The boots are made with a full grain Crazy Horse Leather upper, which flexes comfortably as you walk and boasts impressive durability. The composite toe keeps you protected from impacts around heavy cargo and equipment, and is lighter than a traditional steel toe. Designed to adapt to temperatures ranging from subfreezing to 65 F/18 C, these mens work boots combine a Hydroguard waterproof breathable membrane with moisture-wicking Airmesh lining, keeping your feet dry and comfortable in any season. They have a lightweight cushioned EVA midsole to help keep end of day aches and pains at bay, while Gel-Core sub-sole cushioning adds extra protection during long hours of standing on unforgiving surfaces. Additional Achilles support and a tempered steel shank provide extra stability, while a rugged Super Grip outsole gives these men's leather work boots reliable traction on slick surfaces.

The tea was named genmaicha, literally brown rice tea, and earned the nickname the peoples tea for its thrifty invention. Though originally employed to save cost, the resulting tea became so popular that even as tea became more affordable, genmaicha is still regularly enjoyed in Japan. Today, genmaicha tea is made with higher quality sencha leaves to provide the best flavor. One particular tea tradition also blends genmaicha with the famous powdered matcha, thus creating a unique and flavorful green tea blend.
